title: Conceptual Understanding Through Deep Cognitive Learning of the Greenhouse Effect and Global Warming

context.prior_knowledge: Intermediate-level subject-matter expertise and problem-solving abilities
context.additional_context: Online science education course for non-degree-seeking adult learners: Emphasizing self-directed learning via LMS and discussion-based interaction

learning_goals: Learners can explain the physical mechanisms of the greenhouse effect, focusing on energy flow and radiative balance
Learners can distinguish and analyze the primary causes of global warming, including natural and anthropogenic factors
Learners can identify misconceptions related to the greenhouse effect (e.g., greenhouse gases = atmospheric temperature) and reconstruct them using scientific models
Learners can interpret long-term climate change prediction models and propose methods for assessing social impacts
difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
